==History==
==History==
  +
[[File:Portable Workspace Creator.png|thumb|Portable Workspace Creator on Windows 8 build 7955]]
[[File:Windows To Go USB Flash Drive.png|thumb|One of the USB flash drives offered by Microsoft at the BUILD conference with Windows To Go pre-installed]]
[[File:Windows To Go USB Flash Drive.png|thumb|One of the USB flash drives offered by Microsoft at the BUILD conference with Windows To Go pre-installed]]
In April, 2011, after the leak of Windows 8 build 7850<ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/04/13/windows-8-leaked-caught-looking-a-lot-like-windows-7/</ref>, some users noticed that those builds included a program called "Portable Workspace Creator", indicating it was intended to create bootable USB drives of Windows 8.<ref>http://www.winrumors.com/windows-8-portable-workspace-allows-you-to-run-windows-from-a-usb-device/</ref><ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/04/15/windows-8-to-feature-usb-runnable-portable-workspaces-sales-of/</ref>
In April, 2011, after the leak of Windows 8 build 7850<ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/04/13/windows-8-leaked-caught-looking-a-lot-like-windows-7/</ref>, some users noticed that those builds included a program called "Portable Workspace Creator", indicating it was intended to create bootable USB drives of Windows 8.<ref>http://www.winrumors.com/windows-8-portable-workspace-allows-you-to-run-windows-from-a-usb-device/</ref><ref>http://www.engadget.com/2011/04/15/windows-8-to-feature-usb-runnable-portable-workspaces-sales-of/</ref>
